answers.answer: Ladies I m worried n need ur to see if someone has experienced it

Usually they test around 26 weeks so I don't know why they're doing it now. I would say if you don't have gd you're at least borderline.... honestly your so close to the end it shouldn't make a huge difference. Just avoid sugars and carbs so it stays down
If you haven't tested postive before your pregnancy its probably, just because your pregnant.With my first I score a 156 out of 140 but once the pregnancy was over I was fine.

I'll be having mine on the 9th, a lot of women say they pass if they don't eat after midnight the previous night, your sugar will be higher if you've eaten recently of course. Did you have some good breakfast?

I just had mine at 34 weeks and i was just over and measuring big they said itshldnt be a problem so long as baby doesnt gain to much weigt i have a ultra sound booked for 37 wks to check if so they will be inducing me early..They sent me to the diabetic clinic and taught me how to eat correctly and gave me a diabetes monitor thingy and so far my results are all good just ask ur doctor wat the next step to take is im in perth wa i dont know where u are and how ur hospital works but its up to them to tell u the next step good luck
They also told me it may be just gestational diabetes and i have to do the glucose test wen baby is 6 mnths to see if i didnt have it before i feel pregnant
I highly recommend you talk with your obstetrician about this. He or she would be able to provide you with answers!!
I'm wondering why your test was given so late. You need to consult your ob, not an internet forum.

question: I need to ask do anyone of you had gct I.e,glocose challenge test,at 35 weeks.I had my report today which says I have 148mg sugar in my blood and the cut off value is 140mg,it means I have crossed the border.does it means that I have gestational diabetes?do I need a Glocuse tolerance test to make it confirm?
title: GCT at 35+weeks
